Welcome!

Source: vignettes/index.qmd

Overview

The registers2parquet package is designed to convert Danish register data from the SAS file format to the Apache Parquet format, also commonly referred to as Parquet. This vignette provides an introduction to the package, its purpose, and the benefits of using Parquet for data storage and analysis.

For an in-depth look at the package design, please refer to the vignette("design").

For an introduction to using the package, please see the guides.

Purpose

The primary purpose of the registers2parquet package is to simplify the process of converting the large Danish registers into the more modern Parquet storage format as well as to simplify reading these Parquet files.

By converting data from SAS to the more modern and efficient Parquet format, the package reduces storage costs and aims to improve performance in data analysis workflows.

Why Parquet?

Parquet is a columnar storage file format that is optimized for use with big data processing frameworks. There are several advantages of using Parquet for Danish register data instead of SAS files:

  • Reduced storage costs: Parquet’s efficient compression can lead to significant savings in storage costs, especially for large datasets.
  • Faster data processing: The columnar format of Parquet can lead to faster data processing times, particularly for analytical queries that only require a subset of the data.
  • Easier integration with modern data tools: Parquet’s wide support across various data processing frameworks makes it easier to integrate Danish register data into modern data analysis workflows, like R or Python.

Apache also offers several advantages over traditional row-based file formats (like CSV), particularly when dealing with large datasets:

  • Efficient data compression: Parquet uses efficient compression

    algorithms, which can significantly reduce the amount of disk space required to store large datasets.

  • Improved query performance: By storing data in a columnar format, Parquet allows for more efficient querying and data retrieval, especially when only a subset of columns is needed.

  • Interoperability: Parquet is widely supported by various data processing frameworks and tools, making it a versatile choice for data storage and analysis.
